intro: Aciotis dysophylla, commonly known as the Mexican dandelion, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in arid environments. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in the spring and are followed by fluffy seed heads. Aciotis dysophylla is valued for its medicinal properties and is sometimes used in traditional herbal remedies.
